header.description: Three scalar tokens displayed in the report header: the reporting period dates (user-supplied parameters) and the generation timestamp (server-injected at run time).

rows.description: One row per device in app_devices. All seven row tokens map directly to columns in that table. No filtering, grouping, or aggregation â€” full inventory snapshot.

totals.description: No totals section in this report.

semantics: date_from and date_to are pure display parameters passed through to the header; they do NOT filter the device rows. generated_at is a server-side run-time injection (current timestamp). All row data is drawn directly from app_devices with no filtering.
transformations: No reshape: data comes from a single flat table (app_devices) with no MELT or UNION_ALL needed.
row_latency_ms formatted to 1 decimal place for display.
row_auto_reconnect displayed as raw value (0/1 or boolean string) from the database.
